kou commented on pull request #4317: ARROW-5311: [C++] use more specific error status types in take
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4317#discussion_r284887186
 
 

 ##########
 File path: c_glib/arrow-glib/error.cpp
 ##########
 @@ -37,78 +37,68 @@ G_BEGIN_DECLS
  * values.
  */
 
-G_DEFINE_QUARK(garrow-error-quark, garrow_error)
+G_DEFINE_QUARK(garrow - error - quark, garrow_error)
 
 Review comment:
   This should not be included spaces around `-`.
   `G_DEFINE_QUARK` is a macro. `garrow-error-quark` is used as an identifier.
   
   Arrow GLib doesn't use the same coding style as Arrow C++. So we don't need to use `clang-format`.
   I'll send a pull request to revert this change.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Currently the {{Take}} kernel returns generic Invalid Status for certain cases, that could use more specific error:

- indices of wrong type (eg floats) -> TypeError instead of Invalid?
- out of bounds index -> new IndexError ?

From review in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4281

cc [~bkietz]
fields.summary: [C++] Return more specific invalid Status in Take kernel

comments.body: I think we could probably add a Status::IndexError on the C++ side to designate out-of-bounds conditions (when detected :-)). [~wesmckinn] [~xhochy] what do you think?
Seems OK to me, interested in other opinions
Alternatively: we could just use KeyError

With IndexError, we could match typical behaviour on the python side (out of bound indices give IndexError in Python), but of course this is specific to Python, so that should not necessarily drive a change on the C++ side.
{{KeyError}} is more for column or field names etc.
